verses.verse: (Ezra) ((1 Cyrus sendeth again the people that was in captivity, 8 and restoreth them their holy vessels.) ) Now (Cross references: : 2 Chron. 3:22; Jer. 25:12; Jer. 29:10) in (After that he and Darius had won Babylon.) the first year of Cyrus King of Persia (that the word of the LORD, spoken by the (Who promised them deliverance after that seventy years were past, Jer. 25:12.) mouth of Jeremiah, might be accomplished) the Lord stirred up the (That is, moved him, and gave him heart.) spirit of Cyrus King of Persia, and he made a proclamation through all his kingdom, and also by writing, saying,

Thus saith Cyrus King of Persia, The Lord God of heaven hath given me (For he was chief Monarch, and had many nations under his dominion, which this heathen king confesseth to have received of the living God.) all the kingdoms of the earth, and he hath commanded me to build him an house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
Who is he among you of all his people with whom his God is? let him go up to Jerusalem which is in Judah, and build the house of the Lord God of Israel: he is the God, which is in Jerusalem.

And everyone that remaineth in any place (where he sojourneth) (If any through poverty were not able to return, the kingâ€™s commission was that he should be furnished with necessaries.) let the men of his place relieve him with silver and with gold, and with substance, and with cattle, (Which they themselves should send toward the reparation of the Temple.) and with a willing offering, for the house of God that is in Jerusalem.
Then the chief fathers of Judah and Benjamin, and the Priests and the Levites rose up, with all them whose spirit God had raised to go up, to build the house of the Lord which is in Jerusalem.

And all (The Babylonians and Chaldeans gave them these presents: thus rather than the children of God should want for their necessities, he would stir up the heart of the very infidels to help them.) they that were about them, strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with substance and with cattle, and with precious things, besides all that was willingly offered.

Also the king Cyrus brought forth the vessels of the house of the Lord, (2 Kings 25:13; 2 Chron. 36:7; Jer. 27:1920; Dan. 1:2) which Nebuchadnezzar had taken out of Jerusalem, and had put them in the house of his god.

Even them did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and counted them unto (So the Chaldeans called Zerubbabel who was the chief governor, so that the preeminence still remained in the house of David.) Sheshbazzar the Prince of Judah.
And this is the number of them, thirty basins of gold, a thousand basins of silver, nine and twenty (Which served to kill the beasts that were offered in sacrifice.) knives,
Thirty bowls of gold, and of silver bowls of the second sort, four hundred and ten, and of other vessels, a thousand.

All the vessels of gold and silver were five thousand and four hundred. Sheshbazzar brought up all (With the Jews that had been kept captives in Babylon.) with them of the captivity that came up from Babel to Jerusalem.
